Well the new changes which might require clarification are:
1) the ability to pass constructor input which is documented here: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin#starknet-deploy
it introduces the same `--inputs` option which is present in Starknet CLI command `deploy`, the only difference is that you have to quote the inputs, I think that's the only way of passing them all due to a strange limitation with how Hardhat works
That basically means if you want to pass two constructor arguments (e.g. 10 and 20) you would run this:
```
hh starknet-deploy <PATH_TO_CONTRACT> --starknet-network <NETWORK_NAME> --inputs "10 20"
```

New version of `starknet-hardhat-plugin` (v0.3.5) has been released:

- Improve `getContractFactory` (the function that creates a contract factory from the provided contract):
  - Handle ambiguous input.
  - Allow specifying the contract by the path of its source.

Content:
The hardhat StarkNet plugin `starknet.stringToBigInt(contract.address)` supports strings up to length 31 thus preventing the utility from being used for Ethereum addresses.
```
HardhatPluginError: Strings must have a max of 31 characters.
```
The alternative is to do BigInt(contract.address).toString()

Simply passing `contract.address` results in

HardhatPluginError: constructor: Expected l1_address to be a felt

Author: DiogoR#6801
Content:
Hi, this is because Starknet at the moment only supports short strings, which are strings <= 31 characters https://www.cairo-lang.org/docs/how_cairo_works/consts.html?#short-string-literals
So passing something larger than that would result in an error like `<StarkErrorCode.OUT_OF_RANGE_FIELD_ELEMENT: 36>, 'message': 'Field element 0x313233343536373839303132333435363738393031323334353637383930313233 is out of range`

Content: you should actually just do `BigInt(contract.address)`

Content: Wanted to share a workflow pattern that is working fairly well for me for including third party libs. I'm setting `paths.cairoPaths = [ './node_modules' ]`  in the hardhat config and then using npm to install packages either from git repos, or npm (when published) and aliasing (ex. `npm install --save-dev influenceth__cairo_math_64x61@npm:@influenceth/cairo-math-64x61`). Content:
There are plans to make Devnet run in Hardhat background, similar to
- hardhat-ganache: https://hardhat.org/plugins/nomiclabs-hardhat-ganache.html
- hardhat-network: https://hardhat.org/hardhat-network/
However, what these two approaches lack and what Postman (L1-L2) communication requires is being reachable through a URL. If there is a way to interact with hardhat-ganache or hardhat-network outside of Hardhat, then you wouldn't have to run an L1 testnet in a separate process. So even if Devnet was made available in a similar plugin, it would be good if it also exposed itself outside of Hardhat (with a URL).

Author: fabijanspaceshard
Content:
**Funds and fees** through the **Hardhat plugin** on **alpha-goerli** and **Devnet** (https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin#funds-and-fees)
-   **On alpha-goerli**
    -   Deploy an account using `starknet.deployAccount`
    -   Give it finds through [the faucet](https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/)
    -   Later load the account using `starknet.getAccountFromAddress`
-   **On starknet-devnet**
    -   Since v0.2.3, Devnet comes with prefunded accounts which use the OpenZeppelin account implementation v0.1.0
    -   Use the data logged by Devnet on startup (address, key)
    -   Load one of the predeployed accounts using `starknet.getAccountFromAddress`
    -   [Read more](https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-devnet#predeployed-accounts)

Once your account has funds, you can specify a maximum fee greater than zero:
```typescript
await account.invoke(contract, "foo", { arg1: ... }, { maxFee: BigInt(...) });
```

`deployAccount` doesn't accept fees and currently works **without** them
`starknet-hardhat-plugin` not yet fully compatible with Starknet 0.9.0
cc @Nick Ulven

Author: fabijanspaceshard
Content:
New version of `starknet-hardhat-plugin` (v0.6.0) has been released:
https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin/releases/tag/v0.6.0
- Introduced timestamp manipulation functions (Devnet only):
  - `starknet.devnet.setTime(1000)`
  - `starknet.devnet.increaseTime(500)`
- Added support for named tuples, nested tuples and type aliases as function arguments.
- Adapted to cairo-lang/starknet 0.9.0:
  - Introduced the `declare` method to the `StarknetFactory` class:
    - `const classHash = await contractFactory.declare()`
- Updated the Argent account version used (v0.2.2):
  - **BREAKING CHANGES**:
    - Guardian not used by default anymore (it's set to 0).
    - Initialization with a fundedAccount required after deployment:
      - `const acc = <ArgentAccount> await starknet.deployAccount("Argent")`
      - `await acc.initialize({ fundedAccount, maxFee })`
  - Useful scripts:
    - `deploy-argent.ts`: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-example/blob/9b3b43d6500386a116c9641dc473ad873cccd607/scripts/deploy-argent.ts
    - `transfer-funds.ts`: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-example/blob/9b3b43d6500386a116c9641dc473ad873cccd607/scripts/transfer-funds.ts
- Updated the OpenZeppelin account version used (OZ commit b27101eb8).
- Automatically fetching `-arm` docker images on arm64 computers.
- Fixed support for interaction with Devnet on WSL and mac when used with the dockerizedVersion of the plugin.
- Adapted to the new Voyager verification API.
- Added support for relative paths as arguments to `getContractFactory`.
- `integrated-devnet` - [docs](https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin#runtime-network---integrated-devnet):
  - Not marked as experimental anymore.
  - Added `args` property to `integratedDevnet` hardhat config definition to allow passing Devnet CLI arguments (e.g. `--lite-mode`).

Content:
New version of `starknet-hardhat-plugin` (v0.6.4) has been released:
https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin/releases/tag/v0.6.4
- Applied the proxy-server optimization to all commands and to the dockerized mode (v0.6.3 only optimized venv mode and didn't optimize `starknet-compile`)
- Introduced the `hardhat starknet-plugin-version` command

Author: fabijanspaceshard
Content:
If you are experiencing `DEPRECATED_TRANSACTION` issues, that's because you are attempting an old-style deploy transaction. StarkNet has recently deprecated these transactions (on alpha-goerli testnets and alpha-mainnet). `starknet-hardhat-plugin` versions before 0.7.0 rely on this old-style deployment (the last such version is 0.6.8).

Currently these txs are only accepted on `starknet-devnet` (latest Devnet version at the time of writing is 0.4.2), but Devnet will also soon deprecate them: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-devnet/issues/356

The best thing you can do is **upgrade to the latest version** of `starknet-hardhat-plugin`: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin/releases/latest
Since version 0.7.0, `starknet-hardhat-plugin` internally takes care of the correct way of deployment so you don't have to bother with it, but there are a few breaking changes which are all described here: https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-hardhat-plugin/releases/tag/v0.7.0

If you want to know what's happening internally: instead of directly sending an old-style deploy tx, the plugin (and other client apps), invoke the _universal deployer contract_ (UDC), which is now the recommended way of deploying new contracts
